intro: Galium ruprechtii, commonly known as mountain bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Galium ruprechtii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its growth habit is low and spreading, often forming dense mats that help stabilize soil in rocky or disturbed areas.
